LanguageData.HS_EdoProduction.label: edo production
LanguageData.HS_EdoRecreationalFood.label: Recreational Foods
LanguageData.HS_EdoRecreationalFood.description: Recreational food enjoyed around the edo period.
LanguageData.HS_Basic_Samurai_Smithing.label: Basic Metalworking
LanguageData.HS_Basic_Samurai_Smithing.description: Self reliance is paramount to our survival. Instead of depending on others we must forge our own equipment.
LanguageData.HS_Clanforged_Weapons.label: Clanforged Weapons
LanguageData.HS_Clanforged_Weapons.description: Using secrets passed down among clans we can forge lighter, stronger and more elegant weapons.
LanguageData.HS_EdoElectricKamado.label: electric kamado
LanguageData.HS_EdoElectricKamado.description: We can modify our kamado to use power instead of fuel.
LanguageData.HS_HayWeaving.label: hay weaving
LanguageData.HS_HayWeaving.description: Weave hay into hats and cloaks.
LanguageData.HS_EdoClothing.label: edo clothing
LanguageData.HS_EdoClothing.description: Learn to make basic edo themed clothing.
LanguageData.HS_EdoBuildings.label: edo buildings
LanguageData.HS_EdoBuildings.description: Learn how to make various different edo style buildings.
LanguageData.HS_BlackPowder_Research.label: Black Powder Weapons
LanguageData.HS_BlackPowder_Research.description: Black powder, one of four great inventions of China. It makes a potent defense tool, it can be used to fire guns or be stuffed in a barrel and lit.
LanguageData.HS_Mastercraft_Armor.label: Mastercraft Armor
LanguageData.HS_Mastercraft_Armor.description: Learn to create masterwork armor fit for the Shogun.
